‚ö†Ô∏è Note: California has one of the highest state income tax rates in the US (up to 13.3% for earners over $1M). This calculator estimates CA state + federal taxes for 2026.

California State Tax Guide 2026

California has the highest marginal state income tax rate in the United States at 13.3%. The state uses a progressive tax system with 9 tax brackets, ranging from 1% to 12.3%, plus an additional 1% Mental Health Services Tax on income over $1 million.

üî• California Tax Rates 2026:
  • 9 tax brackets - 1% to 12.3%
  • +1% Mental Health Tax on income over $1 million
  • Top rate: 13.3% (highest in the nation)
  • Standard Deduction: Single $5,540 | Married $11,080

California Standard Deduction 2026

  • Single: $5,540
  • Married Filing Jointly: $11,080
  • Head of Household: $11,080

  • Single: $16,100
  • Married Filing Jointly: $32,200
  • Head of Household: $24,150

California Mental Health Services Tax

California imposes an additional 1% tax on taxable income exceeding $1 million, bringing the top marginal rate to 13.3%. This tax funds mental health programs under Proposition 63 (passed in 2004).

Pros and Cons of Living in California

Pros:

  • Great weather year-round
  • Strong economy and job market
  • Tech hub (Silicon Valley)
  • Diverse culture and entertainment
  • Beautiful beaches and nature

Cons:

  • Highest state income tax in the US (13.3%)
  • Very high cost of living
  • High property taxes
  • High sales tax (average 8.85%)
  • Traffic congestion in major cities

California vs Other High-Tax States

State Top Income Tax Rate Notes
California13.3%Highest in nation
Hawaii11.0%Second highest
New York10.9%Third highest
New Jersey10.75%Fourth highest

Who Leaves California for Tax Reasons?

  • High-income earners: Save 13.3% by moving to TX, FL, NV
  • Retirees: No tax on Social Security in many other states
  • Business owners: Lower taxes and less regulation elsewhere
  • Remote workers: Can work from lower-tax states

Important: This calculator provides estimates for California state and federal taxes. CA's high tax rates make it one of the most expensive states for income taxes. For detailed tax planning, consult with a California CPA or tax professional.
